title: Firefox Stuck in Single-Tab Mode
content:
So, a preface. I rarely used this PC of mine, and thus the Firefox is rarely used as well. When i installed it, i turned on the option 'Open previous windows and tabs'.

Then, once I opened up some kind of offline documentations from Libre Office or Latex, which opened in Firefox. You know, the one where there is no tab appeared, and it just seems like a single pop-up window. I closed it without thinking.

Long enough, i forgot about that and opened up Firefox only to be met with that docs again. Okay, i closed it. But Firefox always started in this kind of pop-up window style ever since (attached). Changing the preference, even deleting the profile doesn't seem to do a thing.

Any recommendation to return Firefox to its original set?

For information: OS: EndeavourOS with Linux 5.15.94 DE: Xfce 4.18 with Xfwm 4.18 Version: Latest, Firefox 110, installed from Arch Linux repository
creator: mardijker

title: Surface Pro 8 recently had No Synced Logins Found while other devices do not have this issue
content:
I have 2 Windows devices, Surface Pro 8 & a Lenovo Legend, both almost identical Windows 11 build and same FF version(V110.0).

Only about 2 weeks ago, I started noticing these odd things on the Surface Pro 8 : - When first launch, FF window will open, and shuts down immediately. Second launch OK. - Few days ago, pw sync started to fail completely with the message "No synced Logins Found" when I go to the password screen.

I checked into my FF account and it tells me the both devices are signed-in.

Tried clicking on Sync in Levono as well as the Surface - no effect.

My Sync settings sync all syncable items.

Any user with Surface Pro 8 (running the latest Win 11 Update) has this problem? My Lenovo machine running FF normally.

Thank you.
creator: ncp14

title: updates keep resetting cookies
content:
These constant updates are getting very annoying in main because they keep resetting my cookie settings so I'm constantly having to go through the accept or decline cookie on site a visit all the time.

I have used Firefox for many years and it has never needed this amount of updates

content:
The new Mozilla Firefox (version 110.0) does not run after update on my system. After run it shows the window, but this window doesn't respond. The clean installation (of course with profile folder erase) doesn't fix the problem. I have tried both x64 and x86 versions.

The previous version installation (109.0.1) works fine.

There are some screenshots included. I use Windows 7 on Ryzen 7 2700X processor. Could you please advice, what can be done here?
creator: VZtXRbQfVD

title: Firefox logging me out of all sites when I "delete history"
content:
Hello,

this problem started happening around 3 or 4 days ago.

Usually, at the end of the day or before I close Firefox, I "delete browsing history" BUT only the "today" history. I know it's a weird habit (lol), but at least it logs me out of all recent browsing while keeping my sessions with older websites active (typically these older websites include stuff that I use frequently like Outlook, Google/Youtube, Twitter & other social media, Spotify, and a few other sites).

The other reason I do this is that I like my "recent history" to be ordered the way I like, so I can use it kind of like a "bookmark list".

The problem: Since about 4 days ago, each time I "delete history", ALL my accounts are signed out. Note that I don't have the option to delete cookies upon closing checked, and whenever I close Firefox without deleting history the sessions appear to be active.

I think 3 or 4 days ago there was a Firefox update? I remember at the time I was shown the extra tab with the release notes, but I didn't pay much attention. However when I noticed the issue, which was the day after, I assumed it was a new feature of the update that caused all these websites not to recognise my browser and thus ask me to log in again.

So just before going to bed, I tried 1) clearing my history for the day as I usually do, except 2) instead of closing directly after, I would go to the sites I want to remain logged in (in this case I just did Outlook, Youtube, Twitter, Facebook, Tiktok and Spotify), log into my accounts, and then close the browser.

So the following day, it worked "as usual"... almost... that is because when I deleted my history of the day, it logged me out of everything again. But in the "recent history" list, it showed the updated list (with the websites I re-logged into the day before).

So I can't guess what is happening, other that something is messing with my cookies each time I delete history. I even went to check manually to see if I still had the session cookies stored in Firefox and it appears to be the case.

Yesterday I also tried logging into a Google, waiting a few hours, and only deleting the history of the past hour, but the same thing happens, I instantly get logged out.

Additional info: when I "delete history" I only check the first five options (those under history) and not the lower two (under data).

Thanks for your help, and sorry for my English !
creator: Mooray

title: URL autofill setting
content: Hello, I recently had to clear my cache and now Firefox no longer remembers any URLs that I visit regularly. I've looked at all my settings and don't see anything different from what I had before I cleared the cache. I'm talking about URLs that I visit every day. They just don't get autofilled and I don't know why. Thanks
creator: sarah.berry9

title: White border that disables window snapping
content: For a couple of months now, I've been plagued a white border that sometimes appears on Firefox. I don't know what causes it to appear, but it always appears after some sort of input. When it appears, nothing can make it go away and the Firefox window won't snap to the side of the screen. It does get fixed if I close and reopen Firefox, but of course this loses all of my tabs. I've tried several solutions to fix this, but it keeps happening no matter what I've tried.
creator: jamesclugston

title: Starting Firefox on remote machine runs local version
content:
I have several machines on my local network. I work on machine A, and run applications remotely using ssh -X on the other machines. Today I discovered that when I start Firefox on newly-upgraded machine B, it's actually starting the older version that's on machine A. This seems obviously wrong, and is certainly not what I want to happen. I want to run the newer Firefox that's on B, and have it display on A.

Longer details: A runs OpenSUSE Leap 15.0. B runs Leap 15.4. I start an xterm on B with the command " "ssh -X -l me B", and programs other than Firefox I run from that xterm display on A's monitors, as expected. However, when I try to run Firefox (by typing "firefox &" on the command line, what actually runs is the older version of Firefox that is on A, just as if I'd started it with the same command on one of A's terminals.

Is this a known behavior, and if so, is there a way to work around it? Or am I just doing something really stupid?
creator: jamesqf

title: Audio won't play on browser, have tried everything only found one temporary fix
content:
I'm having audio issues with the Firefox browser specifically. This is my default browser, but for some reason, it suddenly stopped projecting audio from in-browser sources.

I've cleared my cache and tried other solutions from the help page, but nothing seems to work except when I reinstall my audio drivers. However it's a temporary fix as it seems to only play audio for videos that I already have loaded, but if I skip ahead in the video or refresh the page, the audio problem comes back.

Every other application works, and i've tried other browsers to make sure it's specifically a firefox issue and it is.

I've gone into troubleshooting mode, turned off all of my extensions, and nothing seems to work which is odd. Audio still plays normally for other applications like Spotify, Discord, Steam, etc.
creator: Deffron2012

title: Dragon NaturallySpeaking beeps after each recognition during voice dictation since last update version 110
content: I use the voice dictation program called Dragon NaturallySpeaking to do most of my typing and navigate through webpages. After Firefox updated to version 110 it now beeps after each word, phrase or sentence I dictate. Dragon NaturallySpeaking has settings where you can turn this on and off, and I have it turned off but it still beeps. Wondering if there are any fixes or if I can go to a previous version. Thanks!
creator: injured_cowboy

Thank you. Bella De Soto

title: while using Bypass Paywalls Clean v3.0.4.0 in Firefox photos in stories will not open
content: While using Bypass Paywalls Clean v3.0.4.0 add-on in Firefox photos in stories will not open. It worked before so I contacted the add-on maker and after the last contact he called me a troll and blocked me. But still the problem happens when a story has photos I use to be able to click on the View icon and the photos would open in a new tab now nothing happens. I am using Firefox 88.0b9 (64-bit) because I do not like the changes the newer versions have and this version works well and has opened the photos before this problem started. I have added a grab of a story with photos to show the View icon. I understand I am cheating by using the Bypass but if I subscribed to all the sites I visit I would go bankrupt. Any help greatly appreciated.
creator: phillstroud
